text:
<!channel> Having recently moved into a new industry (I'm now in Tech but was in oil & gas), something I've really noticed is how much the *network* I'd built in my old industry helped me get by ... and how much easier things would be if I had one in my new industry!

*E-Mentors:* How does your network help you? And how can our Mentees go about building one as they enter the workforce for the first time?

(BTW feel free to take the convo wherever you like!)
Good question @emma. Generally speaking there are many benefits to being part of a wider network and growing your own network once you start in a new industry.
In commercial real estate there are many industry events and talks where you can get together and discuss with others what the big issues are
This lets you understand how others view the industry you're in and the events which affect you

If I think about my network, I often use it to sense check. Sense check on costs, processes and information. How mentees can build this up? Start taking an interest in every person they meet and be prepared with 3 questions for them. Most people like to share their experience, so once they get talking to someone, it can be fluent from there. One thing that helps is thinking of the first sentence they want to say to that person :-) helps with the nerves.
